page.title: 08FULNECK MORAVIAN CUSTOMS
page.content: At{Christenings}the chapel servant carries the baby into the church on a pillow. At{Christmas,}Moravians hang up stars and give out{Christingles.}Each is made of an orange (the world), red ribbon (Jesus' blood), sweets (God's food), quills (God's creatures) and a white candle (Jesus' light). On{Easter Day,}the service starts at 7 a.m. A brass band plays and this year about 70 people sang hymns in the graveyard, and then had breakfast in the Boys' School. A{Love Feast}is held on the first Sunday of each month. Ladies wear a black dress, white shawl and white bonnet with pink ribbon if single, blue if married and white if widowed. They serve bread buns and unsweetened tea to everyone.
